intro: Uvariastrum elliotianum var. sericeum, commonly known as the silky uvaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving the plant its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
